questions.question: I ............................... him that we had not paid the utility bill yet.
questions.description: We remind someone to do something they might forget.

questions.question: I'm afraid I won't ............................... his face.
questions.description: Remember and remind have different meanings. To remind is to make someone remember.

questions.question: We use only the bedroom and the kitchen. ............................... of the house is empty.
questions.description: The rest means what is left. The article 'the' is always used in this expression.

questions.question: ............................... of the meal were lying all over the floor.
questions.description: We can use the word remains to talk about what is left after something has been used up.

questions.question: You and Peter can take four chocolates each. The rest ............................... mine.
questions.description: When the rest refers to a plural noun, the verb is plural.

questions.question: Show me ............................... again.
questions.description: We normally use the article the before same.

questions.question: You have got ............................... .
questions.description: We use the same as before a noun or pronoun.

questions.question: That is the same man ............................... asked me for directions yesterday.
questions.description: Before a clause we can use the same ... that / the same ... who

questions.question: 'Turn left, 'I ................................'
questions.description: We use tell when there is an object. If there is no object, we use say.

questions.question: She ............................... me that she would come.
questions.description: We use tell when there is an object.

questions.question: We will ............................... that problem tomorrow.
questions.description: When see means think or consider, a preposition is necessary before the object.

questions.question: ............................... this color suits you.
questions.description: See can be followed by if or whether. This expression has the same meaning as find out.
